taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek lithos, stone, and carpos, fruit, referring to the hard fruit wall]

bio:treatment.discussion: Although fruit of Lithocarpus closely resembles that of Quercus, the two genera differ in characters of the inflorescence, flowers, and pollen. These characters indicate that Lithocarpus is more closely related to Castanea, Chrysolepis, and other Asian genera of subfamily Castaneoideae than to Quercus, and the similarity in fruit is because of convergence.
